action.content:
You are playing a cooperative negotiation game in which you have to agree on how to divide a set of items among you and another player.

Rules:
(a) You and the other player are given a set of items. Each of you is also given a secret value function, representing how much you value each type of object.
(b) You exchange messages with the other player to agree on who gets which items. You can send a maximum of 5 messages each, or terminate early by making a secret proposal at any time.
(c) You are each asked to submit a secret proposal indicating the items you want formatted in square brackets as follows: "[Proposal: <number> <object name>, <number> <object name>, <...>]"
(d) If your proposals are complementary, i.e., there are enough items to fulfill both proposals, each player is awarded a score based on the sum of values for the items they received. Otherwise, both of you get zero points.
(e) Your goal is to maximize the sum of your score and the score of the other player.

Let us start.

The set of available items is:

3 statues, 1 nail, 1 hammer

Your secret value function is:

statue: 3, nail: 1, hammer: 0

IMPORTANT: Your messages, unless it is the secret proposal, are directly transmitted to the other player, so do not include any response to the rules or text announcing your message. To make a secret proposal, use the indicated format. Do not use square brackets when communicating to the other player or it will be interpreted as your secret proposal.
action.label: context

action.content: Hi! I value statues highly (3 each), nails a bit (1), and hammers not at all (0). How about this: you take the hammer, and we split the statues and nail to maximize total value. For example, I could take the 3 statues and the nail, and you take the hammer. That yields total value 10 for me plus whatever you value the hammer at. If you need some statues too, I’m open to 2 statues + nail for me and 1 statue + hammer for you. What are your values?
action.label: response

If you need some statues too, I’m open to 2 statues + nail for me and 1 statue + hammer for you. What are your values?

You are playing a cooperative negotiation game in which you have to agree on how to divide a set of items among you and another player.

Rules:
(a) You and the other player are given a set of items. Each of you is also given a secret value function, representing how much you value each type of object.
(b) You exchange messages with the other player to agree on who gets which items. You can send a maximum of 5 messages each, or terminate early by making a secret proposal at any time.
(c) You are each asked to submit a secret proposal indicating the items you want formatted in square brackets as follows: "[Proposal: <number> <object name>, <number> <object name>, <...>]"
(d) If your proposals are complementary, i.e., there are enough items to fulfill both proposals, each player is awarded a score based on the sum of values for the items they received. Otherwise, both of you get zero points.
(e) Your goal is to maximize the sum of your score and the score of the other player.

Let us start.

The set of available items is:

3 statues, 1 nail, 1 hammer

Your secret value function is:

statue: 0, nail: 1, hammer: 9

IMPORTANT: Your messages, unless it is the secret proposal, are directly transmitted to the other player, so do not include any response to the rules or text announcing your message. To make a secret proposal, use the indicated format. Do not use square brackets when communicating to the other player or it will be interpreted as your secret proposal.


Hi! I value statues highly (3 each), nails a bit (1), and hammers not at all (0). How about this: you take the hammer, and we split the statues and nail to maximize total value. For example, I could take the 3 statues and the nail, and you take the hammer. That yields total value 10 for me plus whatever you value the hammer at. If you need some statues too, I’m open to 2 statues + nail for me and 1 statue + hammer for you. What are your values?
action.label: context

action.content:
Thanks for laying that out. My values are: statues 0, nail 1, hammer 9. So the hammer is extremely important to me, statues are worthless to me, and the nail is small but positive.

Given that, the efficient split is:
- I take the hammer (value 9 to me, 0 to you)
- You take all 3 statues (value 9 to you, 0 to me)
- Nail can go to you (value 1 to you, 1 to me). I’m happy for you to have it since it doesn’t change total value.

This yields total value 19 (you 10, me 9), which is maximal. If you agree, say so and we can both submit accordingly.
action.label: response

action.content:
Agreed. You take the hammer; I take all 3 statues and the nail.

I will submit: [Proposal: 3 statues, 1 nail]
action.label: response

action.content: The other player has submitted a secret proposal. It is now your turn to submit a proposal of your own.
action.label: context
